revised_title: Andrew Russell Forsyth: A Pioneering Mathematician
tldr: Andrew Russell Forsyth was a prominent mathematician who made significant contributions to the field of elliptic functions and double theta-functions. He discovered the Smith-Forsyth product theorem, which connected the double theta-functions with integrals of the square roots of quintic and sextic polynomials. Forsyth's work helped to unify and organize the complex subject of double theta-functions, making it more accessible to mathematicians.
